intro: Lasiocorys eenii, commonly known as the Malabar boxwood, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to the Western Ghats of India and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a leathery texture with a distinctive waxy coating. The flowers are small, white, and clustered in cymes, often appearing in late winter to early spring.
